name: Casa Marina, A Waldorf Astoria Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Casa Marina for 5 nights and loved every minute of it. The hotel grounds are gorgeous. Two large pools to choose from and they over look the ocean. We spent equal time between the pools and the large private beach. While drinks are a bit expensive at the tiki bar, you have to expect that at a 4 star hotel. Staying at this hotel is like staying in a piece of history. We love the 1920s character of the historic building and can't wait to book this place for next year again. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the service was first rate. We only had to ask for something once and it was taken care of immediately. The staff here are great. The location of the Casa is also excellent for renting bikes, which you can do right at the hotel, to cruise around Key West. In fact, we parked our car and didn't move it again until we left because we ended up riding bikes to Duval every day and evening when we went out. Bikes run about $20/day. You can also rent scooters and mopeds as well as wave runners and boats right on the property. We especially loved the breakfast every morning on the patio with an amazing view of the beach/ocean. We only ate breakfast at the Casa so I'm not sure what the rest of their food is like, but the breakfast was excellent. We will definitely be staying at the Casa Marina again and we're already looking forward to our next trip to Key West.
reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful and First Rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just arrived home from the the most fabulous vacation. I was nervous after reading some of the reviews for this hotel. We found NOTHING to complain about while there for 7 nights & we are picky travelers. The staff is very helpful and friendly. It is truely a luxurious resort. Yes, there is that resort fee that people keep complaining about, but they do tell you about it when you reserve the room- this should be no surprise. Bob and Steve will cater to your every need at the pool and beach alll day. This is a perfect hotel to bring the kids to. The pools were great and we looked forward to the popcicles and frozen towels every afternoon. They showed a "dive in" movie at the pool one night we were there that was fun, too. It is at the quiet end of Duval-but still an easy walk with older kids(7 & 10) to Mallory Sqaure, we did cab it back for $12. We biked everywhere-no car needed. I suggest eating at Salute which is around the corner on the beach-great food and atmosphere. Our favorite place for excellent expresso and a quick breakfast was Anna's Cuban cafe just a couple of blocks away from the hotel. We can't wait to return! Future hotels we stay at now have a lot to live up to! Enjoy your time there...
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: From the very beginning, the staff was attentive and courteous. Rooms were spacious and clean. Resort facilities were exactly what we were looking for in a beach resort stateside. We plan on coming back next year to visit!
reviews.title: Absolutley Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel, the staff is extremely helpful. Excellent beach at the hotel, hammocks, volleyball court. I highly recommend it and I will return.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, staff, rooms, and great beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: No restaurant in the hotel. Very loud air condition (starts every 15 min whole day and night) which is a problem for all rooms on the backside of the main building. Congress hotel (if there is a congress the inside beakfeast rooms are closed for congress people leaving you outside near the pool area even during strong winds. Military airport near the hotel. However, it might be "interesting" for your children to see F18 jets flying only some 100 feets over your heads during the day.
reviews.title: Bad experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed as a couple at the Casa Marina resort in February. I'd read several reviews of the hotel on Trip Advisor prior to our trip, so I felt prepared for both the positives and negatives many people commented about the resort. On the plus side, the resort itself is lovely with beautiful grounds, a fine beach, and relaxing pools. Every staff member we interacted with, from the lobby to the beach-side staff, was good-natured, friendly, and quite helpful. Our room, while in the older part of the hotel and not facing the beach, was perfectly modern and clean, and the bed was comfortable. During our four-night stay, we had no issues with noise or the "paper thin walls" that other reviewers have commented about. On the down side, while the hotel is lovely, my husband and I both had trouble justifying the room rates at the Casa Marina for the amenities you get in return.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Lovely Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel was certainly not worth the $385 a night I spent here. Check-in was not until 4 pm with a checkout by 11 am. The toilet kept running off and on all night. And the restaurant experience was the capper. After waiting 45 minutes from placing my order, the pork chop was not cooked properly. Pink would have been fine but it was raw inside and that's not safe when you are dealing with pork. I did ask for medium and when I showed the waiter, he graciously apologized, got me a glass of wine on the house and said he would ask the chef to butterfly it. Half an hour later, the rubbery overcooked pork chops came out but I ate them anyway because I was starving. To add insult to injury the chef came out and instead of apologizing and making sure my meal was alright, began arguing with me over what color pork should be when you ask for medium. The good news is that my entire meal was comped and the waiter was as polite as can be.
reviews.title: Not worth $385 a night and don't eat here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Jake and Mark!!! They are awesome
reviews.title: Walls really thin or the couple next door really loud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: The couple next door - Too much screaming at 3:00 am. You could hear the bed banging the wall. Yuk
reviews.title: Location is great, but I will not stay at Casa Marina another time if I visit Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location only pro
reviews.title: Glorified Motel 6

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Casa was a wonderful resort, Manny at the front door is hilarious! rooms were clean beach was great and the bartenders kept the drinks flowing.
reviews.title: awsome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I went with a group of 12 guys and we all had a awsome time.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bell/Valet staff was A+. Very fast and attentive. We had a suite with an ocean view. Room could have been cleaner. There was a small amount of food on the floor from the previous guest. Very beautiful pool area and oceanside grill. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Solid service but ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our mid-March trip to the Casa Marina did now begin well. As appears to be case for many visitors, our Kind bed room which we had reserved was not available and we were instead directed to spend the first night with a ground floor, interior facing, 2X double bed room. Add to that, as we were on the front end of Spring Break, we were also next door to loud, drunken college kids (I was one, too, not so long ago. I'll give this a pass..) Of course we were disappointed with this and made our case to the front desk. Patrick at the front desk was extremely helpful and was able to remedy the situation and get us into an ocean view king bed room later the next afternoon. He was extremely courteous, friendly, and highly effective. It's no suprise I see his name mentioned positvely in other reviews. He's truly an asset to the facility.
reviews.title: Gorgeous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Other than the room, the beach and pool are very, very nice. Beach service was also excellent. Namely, Scott from Oklahoma on beach and pool service was exceptional and made a particularly good impression on us with his attentive service and personality.
reviews.title: I Wish I had more Time, What a Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The wonderful ocean view from room 202 along with fantastic service for drinks and meals right on the beach offsets the conditions of the room. After watching the cleaner shove hair, food, dirt, sand, dust, dander, and short curly hairs with a dry worn out towel to the edges of the room, all we did was smile. So don't expect five star cleanliness because that's just not the culture, they don't get that. Be ready to clean your own floor.
reviews.title: Great Beach and Poolside Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The concierge folks at poolside are totally rock star; setting up your lounge chair on the sand and bringing meals, drinks, treats and checking on your every comfort is the best.
reviews.title: Beach Crew Rocks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: Good beach. Perfect location. Marvelous mojitos.
reviews.title: Great location but lacking especially for it being a Waldorf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sun Goddess and her parents owe a debt of gratitude to Mark and Jason and the rest of the Beach Crew in blue for making this the trip of a lifetime! Yes the rooms are clean and well appointed, especially the dreamy pillows, the food was yummy, try the medi plate, and the front desk personnel were helpful and friendly, but it was Mark and Jason and the rest of the Beach Crew who truly make the Casa Marina a paradise destination in beautiful Key West! Tell them the Sun Goddess sent you for the eucalyptus and cucumber treatment!
reviews.title: Stay nowhere else in Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: Hotel is an older, historical hotel that has been renovated. The resort has a great private beach and tons of activities on the property. I was disappointed with the rooms. They were very small and only had 20 inch flat screen television. The biggest issue was with cleanliness, there was an empty water bottle on the balcony. For the price, there are better options.
reviews.title: Super attention to comfort needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: My wife and I just booked ourselves in for three nights at the last minute. We had made reservations at a small marina and chose not to stay. We had stayed at the Reach Resort the sister property and called there and were offered accommodations at the Casa Marina as the Reach was fully booked. As nice as the Reach is (we stayed there last year) we both felt the Casa Marina a better value, the room was luxurious, the accommodations top shelf, and the service was as you might expect from a Waldorf Astoria organization. We opted to stay an additional night and the front desk could not have been more helpful(special thanks to Patrick). On our next trip we certainly will make our reservations for another visit to the Casa Marina.My only suggestion would be to ask management to include the daily resort fee in the price since it is not optional.
reviews.title: Terrific service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in this hotel many times, we always have a wonderful time. The staff is very attentive, the rooms are neat and clean. Our only complaints were: that we were on the bottom floor this last stay and the people in the room above us decided to rearrange the furniture at 2a.m.. (although I can't blame the hotel for this, it's not their fault) and the staff, though extremely attentive and pleasant- they must have stopped by our room 4 times one afternoon. Lesson learned- be sure to put out the do not disturb sign.
reviews.title: Beautiful, great staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Casa Marina 4 times. We originally stayed at the sister hotel the Reach, then it closed, but we had met such wonderful people that worked there, we foloowed them to the Casa and never left. They have the best two bartenders in the world, and I do not even drink as a rule. Jan and Robin are the nicest people you would ever want to meet. They treat us like family. This year to my surprise they had a very attentive pool boy named Graham. He put Ricardo to shame. that kid hustles. His buddy Steve isn't bad either. Then there is Brent our room servicve gentleman for the past 4 years. Again, just very nice people. I would hire any of them in a minute.
reviews.title: Ten days in paradise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mary The Tire Lady
reviews.title: Extremely Helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stopped at the Casa Marina to ask about availability and, although there were no rooms available at the time, Patrick at the front desk treated us as if we were the hotel's most important guests. Learning that we had rented bikes, Patrick mapped out a scenic bike route, advised us about restaurants for both lunch and dinner, and offered other suggestions to make our stay on the island most memorable. If Patrick is any indication of the service offered at the hotel, Casa Marina must certainly be a wonderful place to stay. Patrick's warmth and concern made this gorgeous hotel also a welcoming one.
reviews.title: Dated Hotel needs work!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 25 year anniversary escape for 4 nights! What a fabulous experience. I have never been catered on like this before. Excellent friendly staff ready to accomadate your every need. Beautiful ocean front room clean with daily maid service and turn down service at night! Very clean and the most wonderful private beach. We never wanted to leave the resort. Very clean, great food- a bit pricey but what do you expect at much an exclusive place.We will coming back again.
reviews.title: Best Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from this gorgeous hotel, Monday, Feb. 13, 2012. Having been to Key West several times before, we had already seen the "sights" and were perfectly content to stay put in this exceptional property. Every single staff member we encountered had a smile and seemed charged with just making sure we were happy and comfortable, which we were. Some highlights: dinner on the beach with the stars over head, popsicles handed out for everyone on the beach, breakfast buffet (included in our package). Just a great hotel in a fantastic location.
reviews.title: Wonderful Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be sure to get a room or suite on the beach. Ours was 1018.
reviews.title: Nice, although not a 5 star hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Casa Marina is a beautiful hotel and our room was very modern and comfortable, particularly since it was located in the older part of the hotel. We were able to hear the couple in the next room talking, so obviously they were able to hear us and listen to our conversations. This could possibly have been due to the door which adjoined our two rooms. The service was phenomenal and the staff helpful and polite. The $25 resort fee automatically added to the room charge wasn't a good deal for us since we didn't utilize the amenities, and we did feel it should be an optional decision. Although the hotel is very nice and the grounds beautiful, we didn't feel it justified a 5 star rating and didn't live up entirely to the Waldorf standards in relation to the room rates versus ratings. However, we would consider staying there again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and You Get What You Pay For

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel with my Hilton Honors points as this place is much higher priced that I usually spend on a hotel. From the pre-stay emails the service set a pretty high bar. I let the VIP coordinator that emailed me know that we were coming for my wife's birthday. The coordinator made sure the room was prepared for the our ETA with a gift basket of local candies. This was a nice touch. The service from there was only average. The fridge in the room did not work and after a service call it was repaired but never worked completely. We enjoyed drinks by the pool although you should be prepared for a shock when you get your bill. This a Waldorf Astoria and expensive drinks by the pool should be expected.
reviews.title: A fabulous splurge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel offers the best Key West has to offer, a beautiful, pristine beach, 2 pools and a restaurant/bar right on the beach! You don't have to leave this resort at all if you don't want to. The beach staff (yes, there is a beach staff!!) even brings your loungers and towels at the spot you pick on their beautiful beach with hammocks tied to palm trees and a hut where you can book a massage!! The beach staff is there to ensure to take care of any request. The entire staff at this luxurious oasis in Key West is just so very nice and hospitable. They are there to make your vacation a true retreat! The rooms are very clean and comfortable and some have ocean views with a balcony. The exciting night life on Duval Street is a few walking blocks away. Also, around the corner is my favorite restaurant....Louie's Backyard, right on the beach. Make sure to call ahead for reservations, it is fine dining in an open air environment with the best local fish and specials in all of Key West. Overall this is the best place to stay in Key West and this last visit was my third trip. I will always choose Casa Marina as my destination in Key West!
reviews.title: Ahhhh Paradise .........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading quite a few travelers' negative reviews about this resort, we were concerned about our planned 5 night stay there in late March. The resort itself is beautiful. It has a nice beach, two pools and a breezy, modern lovely decor. The service was better than we expected - everyone was very nice and exceedingly helpful with suggestions for dining, walking directions, etc. There are some problems with the resort, however, which should be addressed by the mangement of the hotel. First - our room was supposed to be an upgrade from a standard room (our travel agent booked it and told us about the upgrade). The room was small, overlooking the parking lot and had almost no space for clothing, personal belongings. The safe (which didn't work) and mini-fridge took up nearly all the cabinet space (no drawers anywhere) that should have been available for clothing. My boyfriend basically lived out of his suitcase as there was no place to put his clothes. And sadly, not only did the room have no terrace (which we were not surprised about) BUT the windows do NOT even open. We did ask to change our room and were told that they were fully booked and it wouldn't be possible.
reviews.title: The good, the bad and the ugly...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Much to our chagrin, the "tennis on premises" is a total construction sight. When we asked where the courts were located (we chose this hotel because of the purported tennis on premises), we were told that the courts were "under repair" (not true - we were later told that would probably never be reopened) and we would have to use the public courts next door. Two out the five courts next door were missing their nets and because the public courts are right on the beach the wind was way too fierce to play an enjoyable game. Upon check out - we complained about this and received a credit of the daily resort fee of $20. We did appreciate this, but it didn't make up for the fact that we weren't able to play. We had the buffet breakfast one morning and sat outside to dine. While we (and several other tables) were enjoying our breakfast (food ok - overpriced) a maintenance man was mopping the entire area (with a huge, stringy mop). While he didn't literally ask us to lift our feet to get under our tables, he did get mighty close! And one day the maid came and woke us at 9 AM to clean the room. We asked her to come back later and she never came back! We finally asked the front desk to have our room made up in the mid-afternoon and then were left with NO TOWELS. It took THREE phone calls to actually get someone to bring up towels nearly an hour later! And the computers in the lobby that are for the use of guests are so slow that they are virutally unusable. Anyone we saw using them walked away frustrated that they were unable to check their email, etc.
reviews.title: VERY ROMANTIC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In spite of the problems we did have a good time (the weather was wonderful, after all!) and I feel obligated to mention some of the good things. We were able to walk nearly everywhere (about 15 minutes to Duvall Street) and barely used our car (to park here is an extra $20 per day) We went to some incredible restaurants and had many amazing meals (all outside) - don't miss Blue Heaven (breakfast AND dinner), Sarabeth's (on Sunday night for their fried chicken!), Cafe Sole (hogfish), Azur (mozzarella/tomato/basil salad to DIE for), Nine One Five in the middle of Duvall Street. The snorkeling and kayaking with Danger Charters was terrific. And, if you are driving down from Miami (as we did) stop for lunch at the Morada Bay Beach Cafe at MM 81....what a gorgeous spot.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for a weekend. This is a great place to stay and I would highly recommend it for couples and families. The food is great and they set up a table for you at the bridge, VERY ROMANTIC. I love it , I will definitely come back . Great location, great service.
reviews.title: What you see is what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We decided to stay at the Casa Marina after looking at many hotels in Key West, and overall were quite pleased with the experience.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: pros
reviews.title: Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: -Beautiful setup, right on the water
reviews.title: Beautiful, relaxing vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -two pools and beach with easy access to water sports
reviews.title: Nice facility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: - very aesthetically pleasing
reviews.title: Wonderful

aka: Casa Marina, a Waldorf Astoria Hotel Key West
description: With a $43 million renovation complete, this Mediterranean-inspired resort sits on a 1,100-foot private beach. The historic beachfront resort, combines 1920s ambiance with a chic, contemporary flair, features sophisticated new accommodations, complete with LCD televisions, iPod docking stations, and an in-room espresso, coffee, and tea maker. Amenities include: two tropical pools, water-sports activities, spa services, poolside cabanas, Sun/Sun Bar & Grill serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and The Lobby Lounge for tapas and libations.
